comment: A true example of a keep it simple application.  Worked first time, nice and easy to read. Only upgrades I can think of are, save the data and some sort of timeline. Thank you for no annoying advertising.

author: Rosalie McDonald
comment: This app is too basic for my needs, but it's the only one I've found which connects my fossil q to a wahoo tickr. One annoying bug is that if I leave the app by pressing the crown on my watch, when I reload the app it won't reconnect to the HRM. Instead I must quit the app by swiping right; then it works fine the next time it starts up.

author: Ian Young
comment: No ads, no sign in, no stupid security risks, connected 1st time, nice big digits. I can run Jogtracker in the background to record, and this on top for seeing my instantaneous hr.
title: Simple, perfect

author: Tanya Walker
comment: I can't get it to connect to my watch. Which is a Fossil Q smart watch. Also, it won't read my heart rate.

author: Scott Napier
comment: If this had a time scale and maybe a way to log your heart rate it would be the perfect app.
title: Works, but I would love to see a few tweaks

author: Helder Pais
comment: Awesome app, would be cool if a notion of time could be incorporated.
title: Simple and gets the work done

author: Tosu Tosutosu
comment: It connects instanlynwithnH7. But it would be wonderful if we can have a historical record.
title: Good but not enough

author: Alestair Patterson
comment: Pretty simple and clean... But can't get it to work on my phone...
title: Works on phone but not watch

author: Richard Gordon II
comment: It works with my Smartwatch 3 and Polar HRT strap.

author: Samer Matti
comment: Works with my zenwatch 2 and beets blu cheststrap

author: David Pauling
comment: Ideal.  Simple and works without the phone on my Android Wear watch.

author: Glenn Ammons
comment: This is much easier to use than comparable apps and paired easily with a Scosche Rhythm+.  I found one glitch, which unfortunately makes it unusable for me: if I turn off the watch display by covering the watch with my hand and then turn it back on by tapping the watch, the app no longer updates the heart rate.  My ideal app would also have some way to set up a notification when my heart rate gets too high or too low.  But I would understand if the author didn't want to ruin the simplicity of this app by adding features like that.
